McGraw Epic Love Story {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Alejandro Bazzano'], 'Producers': ['Nacho Manubens', 'Sonia Martinez', 'Josep Cister Rubio', 'Aitor Montanchez'], 'Starring': ['Miguel angel Muñoz', 'Susi Sanchez', 'Elvira Minguez'], 'Studio': ['Atresmedia Television']} This was one of the best productions I've seen from Spain. Beautiful cinematography and breathtaking scenes of the Basque country. One of the reasons I chose to watch it is just that to see the country scenes. This seems to be a "film noir" type with a good plot and an unexpected ending. All new actors for me however, I had seen Susi Sanchez acting in a previous Spanish film. The only thing that I felt was NOT NECESSARY were all the sex scenes in the earlier episodes ... don't believe this contributed to the plot or if they had to throw in sex, the directors could have given it a "softer" touch ... I didn't dock any stars for that though. For those language fans out there, there's a lot of the Basque language you see in the film ... and I picked up some of the simpler Basque greetings. Recommended for mature audiences. A very emotional film depicting the horror of mass murder of innocent people in transit to Auschwitz.
Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Highly recommended for those interested in historical drama. I had never heard of this horrific tragedy in the history of mankind. It was a sad representation of the horrors of the Ukranian people but at the same time showing the determination of the people's desire to fight back.
Highly recommended for world history students.
